unnormalised: The Indian aviation scene is buzzing, isn't it? Esp. with the rise of budget carriers and the ever-increasing demand. It's becoming easier than ever for folks like us to hop on a plane and explore the country. You can fly from Delhi to Goa for as low as Rs. 3500 sometimes – unbelievable! Of course, that's without the extra baggage or that complimentary sandwich they used to give out. Now, that's a bygone era.

Heard they’re planning to add a whole bunch of new routes, maybe even direct flights to some smaller cities. That’ll be a game-changer for sure. Imagine flying direct from Guwahati to Jaipur!

unnormalised: IndiGo, of course, remains the king of the skies. They seem to be adding new flights every other day! Their on-time performance is usually pretty good, around 85%, but sometimes you get stuck in a crazy delay at the airport. It’s all part of the charm, I guess. Remember that time I was stuck at the Bengaluru airport for 6 hours due to fog? Nightmare! But hey, at least the coffee was good.

unnormalised: Vistara is often touted for its premium services, targeting business travellers primarily. While the airline does offer a very comfortable experience, it is not always the most punctual. Additionally, tickets tend to be priced significantly higher than that of competitors like Indigo, often double or more. However, one can find competitive deals on select routes on sites like MakeMyTrip.

unnormalised: One thing I'm really looking forward to is better in-flight Wi-Fi. Right now, most Indian airlines offer a patchy connection, if they offer it at all. I mean, c'mon, it's 2024! We should be able to stream Bollywood movies at 30,000 ft! Also, those baggage fees – seriously, airlines? Charging Rs. 500 for an extra 5 kg? That's a bit much, don't you think?

unnormalised: Overall, the Indian airways are evolving. There are some things that are infuriating such as a recent Air India flight AI-405 which had 10 hours delay, but generally it has become so affordable to explore different parts of the country. Let's hope things will continue to improve with better customer service, smoother operations, and more affordable tickets. Happy flying, folks!
